info.title: Metadata Service API
info.description: Metadata Service provides a phenotypic description of an Individual in the context of biomedical research.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

schema.title: Id
schema.description: Unique arbitrary, researcher-specified identifier for the biosample.

schema.title: Description
schema.description: Human-readable, unstructured text describing the biosample or providing additional information.

schema.title: Sampled tissue
schema.description: An ontology term describing the tissue from which the specimen was collected. The use of UBERON is recommended.

schema.title: Taxonomy
schema.description: An ontology term specified when more than one organism may be studied. It is advised that codesfrom the NCBI Taxonomy resource are used, e.g. NCBITaxon:9606 for humans.

schema.title: Individual age at collection
schema.description: individual_age_at_collection

schema.title: Histological diagnosis
schema.description: An ontology term representing a refinement of the clinical diagnosis. Normal samples could be tagged with NCIT:C38757, representing a negative finding.

schema.title: Tumor progression
schema.description: An ontology term representing if the specimen is from a primary tumour, a metastasis, or a recurrence. There are multiple ways of representing this using ontology terms, and the terms chosen will have a specific meaning that is application specific.

schema.title: Tumor grade
schema.description: An ontology term representing the tumour grade. This should be a child term of NCIT:C28076 (Disease Grade Qualifier) or equivalent.

schema.title: Diagnostic markers
schema.description: A list of ontology terms representing clinically-relevant bio-markers.

schema.title: Is control sample
schema.description: Whether the sample is being used as a normal control.

schema.title: Extra properties
schema.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

schema.title: Individual
schema.description: Identifier for the individual this biosample was sampled from.

schema.title: Hts files
schema.description: A list of HTS files derived from the biosample.

schema.title: id
schema.description: Unique arbitrary, researcher-specified identifier for the biosample.

schema.title: Id
schema.description: An arbitrary identifier for the cancer condition.

schema.title: Condition type
schema.description: Cancer condition type: primary or secondary.

schema.title: Body site
schema.description: Code for the body location, optionally pre-coordinating laterality or direction. Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, ICD-O-3 and others.

schema.title: Laterality
schema.description: Body side of the body location, if needed to distinguish from a similar location on the other side of the body.

schema.title: Clinical status
schema.description: A flag indicating whether the condition is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved (as of the last update of the Condition). Accepted code system: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/condition-clinical

schema.title: Code
schema.description: A code describing the type of primary or secondary malignant neoplastic disease.

schema.title: Date of diagnosis
schema.description: The date the disease was first clinically recognized with sufficient certainty, regardless of whether it was fully characterized at that time.

schema.title: Histology morphology behavior
schema.description: A description of the morphologic and behavioral characteristics of the cancer. Accepted ontologies: SNOMED CT, ICD-O-3 and others.

schema.title: Verification status
schema.description: A flag indicating whether the condition is unconfirmed, provisional, differential, confirmed, refuted, or entered-in-error.

schema.title: Extra properties
schema.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

schema.description: An arbitrary identifier for the cancer condition.

schema.title: Id
schema.description: An arbitrary identifier for the cancer genetic variant.

schema.title: Data value
schema.description: The overall result of the genetic test; specifically, whether a variant is present, absent, no call, or indeterminant.

schema.title: Method
schema.description: The method used to perform the genetic test.

schema.title: Amino acid change
schema.description: The symbolic representation of an amino acid variant reported using HGVS nomenclature (pHGVS).

schema.title: Amino acid change type
schema.description: The type of change related to the amino acid variant.

schema.title: Cytogenetic location
schema.description: The cytogenetic (chromosome) location.

schema.title: Cytogenetic nomenclature
schema.description: The cytogenetic (chromosome) location, represented using the International System for Human Cytogenetic Nomenclature (ISCN).

schema.title: Genomic dna change
schema.description: The symbolic representation of a genetic structural variant reported using HGVS nomenclature (gHGVS).

schema.title: Genomic source class
schema.description: The genomic class of the specimen being analyzed, for example, germline for inherited genome, somatic for cancer genome, and prenatal for fetal genome.

schema.title: Variation code
schema.description: The variation ID assigned by ClinVar.

schema.title: Extra properties
schema.description: Extra properties that are not supported by current schema.

schema.title: Gene studied
schema.description: A gene targeted for mutation analysis, identified in HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee (HGNC) notation.

schema.description: An arbitrary identifier for the cancer genetic variant.

schema.title: Reason code
schema.description: The explanation or justification for why the surgical procedure was performed.

schema.title: Reason reference
schema.description: Reference to a primary or secondary cancer condition.

list.description: Chord phenopacket schema that can be shared with data providers.

schema.title: Page
schema.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

schema.title: Page size
schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

schema.title: Linked field sets
schema.description: Data type fields which are linked together.

schema.title: Alternate identifiers
schema.description: Alternate identifiers for the dataset.

schema.title: Related identifiers
schema.description: Related identifiers for the dataset.

schema.title: Dates
schema.description: Relevant dates for the datasets, a date must be added, e.g. creation date or last modification date should be added.

schema.title: Stored in
schema.description: The data repository hosting the dataset.

schema.title: Spatial coverage
schema.description: The geographical extension and span covered by the dataset and its measured dimensions/variables.

schema.title: Types
schema.description: A term, ideally from a controlled terminology, identifying the dataset type or nature of the data, placing it in a typology.

schema.title: Availability
schema.description: A qualifier indicating the different types of availability for a dataset (available, unavailable, embargoed, available with restriction, information not available).

schema.title: Refinement
schema.description: A qualifier to describe the level of data processing of the dataset and its distributions.

schema.title: Aggregation
schema.description: A qualifier indicating if the entity represents an 'instance of dataset' or a 'collection of datasets'.

schema.title: Privacy
schema.description: A qualifier to describe the data protection applied to the dataset. This is relevant for clinical data.

schema.title: Distributions
schema.description: The distribution(s) by which datasets are made available (for example: mySQL dump).

schema.title: Dimensions
schema.description: The different dimensions (granular components) making up a dataset.

schema.title: Primary publications
schema.description: The primary publication(s) associated with the dataset, usually describing how the dataset was produced.

schema.title: Citations
schema.description: The publication(s) that cite this dataset.

schema.title: Citation count
schema.description: The number of publications that cite this dataset (enumerated in the citations property).

schema.title: Produced by
schema.description: A study process which generated a given dataset, if any.

schema.title: Creators
schema.description: The person(s) or organization(s) which contributed to the creation of the dataset.

schema.title: Licenses
schema.description: The terms of use of the dataset.

schema.title: Acknowledges
schema.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the work reported by the dataset.

schema.title: Keywords
schema.description: Tags associated with the dataset, which will help in its discovery.

schema.title: Version
schema.description: A release point for the dataset when applicable.

schema.title: Extra properties
schema.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.

schema.title: Additional resources
schema.description: Any resource objects linked to this dataset that aren't specified by a phenopacket in the dataset.

schema.title: Has part
schema.description: A Dataset that is a subset of this Dataset; Datasets declaring the 'hasPart' relationship are considered a collection of Datasets, the aggregation criteria could be included in the 'description' field.

schema.title: identifier
schema.description: A UUID string identifying this dataset.

schema.title: Term
schema.description: An ontology term that represents the disease. It's recommended that one of the OMIM, Orphanet, or MONDO ontologies is used for rare human diseases.

schema.title: Onset
schema.description: A representation of the age of onset of the disease

schema.title: Disease stage
schema.description: A list of terms representing the disease stage. Elements should be derived from child terms of NCIT:C28108 (Disease Stage Qualifier) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

schema.title: Tnm finding
schema.description: A list of terms representing the tumour TNM score. Elements should be derived from child terms of NCIT:C48232 (Cancer TNM Finding) or equivalent hierarchy from another ontology.

schema.title: Description
schema.description: Human-readable text describing the phenotypic feature; NOT for structured text.

schema.title: Negated
schema.description: Whether the feature is present (false) or absent (true, feature is negated); default is false.

schema.title: Severity
schema.description: An ontology term that describes the severity of the condition.

schema.title: Modifier
schema.description: A list of ontology terms that provide more expressive / precise descriptions of a phenotypic feature, including e.g. positionality or external factors.

schema.title: Onset
schema.description: An ontology term that describes the age at which the phenotypic feature was first noticed or diagnosed, e.g. HP:0003674.

schema.title: Evidence
schema.description: One or more pieces of evidence that specify how the phenotype was determined.
